title: Rory Stewart
summary: Roderick James Nugent Stewart OBE FRSGS FRSL (born 3 January 1973), known as Rory Stewart, is a British academic, diplomat, explorer, author, soldier and former politician, who is a senior fellow at Yale University's Jackson Institute for Global Affairs where he teaches politics and international relations. Prior to this appointment, he served as a minister in four different departments of the UK government, before being appointed to his final ministerial role, in the Cabinet as Secretary of State for International Development in May 2019. He resigned from this role on 24 July 2019, when Boris Johnson became prime minister. He was also the Member of Parliament (MP) for Penrith and The Border from 2010 to 2019.
